answerText: Mrs. Warren's Profession[10] Mrs. Warren's Profession was written by this Irish playwright who also penned Arms and the Man and Back to Methuselah.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | Editors Packet 2 | 20 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Frank realizes that he may be the main character's relative in this play, which becomes a hindrance for his plan of marriage. For 10 points each: [10] Name the play in which Vivie leaves her mother because she disapproves of her mother's source of wealth.
